summary: This is a USDA employee payroll and time/attendance record for a two-week pay period from July 21 to August 3, 2019. It shows regular work hours, leave usage, and includes validation notes flagging several instances of leave (sick and annual) taken without corresponding approved requests.

persons.name: Heflin
persons.context: Appears as the 'Status Name' in the timesheet validation history, associated with the timestamp of the record's validation on August 5, 2019.

events.title: Unapproved Annual Leave
events.description: A payroll transaction for 8 hours of Annual Leave was recorded with no corresponding approved request.

events.description: A payroll transaction for 8 hours of Annual Leave was recorded with no corresponding approved request.

events.description: A payroll transaction for 8 hours of Annual Leave was recorded with no corresponding approved request.

events.title: Unapproved Sick Leave
events.description: A payroll transaction for 8 hours of Sick Leave was recorded with no corresponding approved request.

events.title: Timesheet Validation
events.description: The employee timesheet for the pay period was validated, noting the discrepancies in unapproved leave.

keyFacts: This is a USDA (Department of Justice) employee payroll and time/attendance record, indicating the document originates from within the U.S. government.
The record covers the pay period of July 21 to August 3, 2019, which includes the date of Jeffrey Epstein's arrest (July 6, 2019) and his death in custody (August 10, 2019).
Multiple leave transactions (Sick Leave on July 30 and Annual Leave on July 22, 24, and 26) were flagged for having no corresponding approved request, suggesting potential timekeeping irregularities.
The document was validated on August 5, 2019, by an individual named Heflin.

The document's file number (EFTA00142460) and webTA system details suggest it was likely produced in response to a records request related to the Epstein case, possibly concerning government personnel.
